issue.title: Support more NIDs in KEM table
issue.body:
This adds extra fields in the generate.yml file to track

- extra hybrid curves (e.g., x25519)
- past NID identifiers

Replaces #311.  Fixes #312.

If we are happy with this general approach, then before this is merged we will need to:

- [ ] Fill in the remaining Kyber Round 2 previous NIDs
- [ ] Set new NIDs for Kyber Round 3 (using values from s2n, if they've been set)

comment.body: @xvzcf You seem to be the most suitable person that can approve this PR now that both @dstebila and @baentsch contributed and vacation time is on: So could you please review (and mark the questions above resolved if you agree with my assessment and fix)?

issue.title: Remove default algs, BIKEr2; add BIKEr3
issue.body:
Pursuant https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/313 

@bhess: When doing this (assumed simple) update I had to notice that the new NIDs you created "extra" now clash with those we had to make up in oqs-openssl to keep "s2n history"... Please check out #26 for a first cut at resolving this issue: Would you want to make a suggestion how to fix things now? Either "registering" your new hybrid NIDs via an amend-commit to https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/313 or amend #26 (change extra-NIDs) here. I'd prefer the latter (updating extra NIDs) to not make things more complicated in oqs-openssl.

comment.body:
I'm ok with the latter option as well, updating the extra NIDs in #26. 

Looking at https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/313, what changes are some 3rd round code points (which can be updated by running generate.py, BIKEr3 with ecx hybrids (which is new for oqs-provider), and the Kyber ecx hybrids (which is now conflicting with oqs-provider). For Kyber-ecx it's ok with me to just update the code point here.

comment.body: OK, shall I then simply chose different NIDs in `generate-extras.yml` or would you want to propose a change to those as a commit-update to this PR?

issue.title: New datasheets
issue.body:
Opening this as a draft PR to get feedback. The main thing to look at is `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` in the latest commit.

- hqc.yml is formatted differently as it was generated by PyYAML (the other non-pqclean datasheets can also be similarly re-generated without much work)
- `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` can be incorporated into `copy_from_upstream.py` once we're set.

comment.body: As discussed yesterday, I updated sike.yml with its different variants/implementations to the new yml structure. Also adapted the yml to pass a `ymllint` check (indentions, document start, line lengths).

issue.title: New datasheets
issue.body:
Opening this as a draft PR to get feedback. The main thing to look at is `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` in the latest commit.

- hqc.yml is formatted differently as it was generated by PyYAML (the other non-pqclean datasheets can also be similarly re-generated without much work)
- `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` can be incorporated into `copy_from_upstream.py` once we're set.

comment.body:
>  Also adapted the yml to pass a ymllint check (indentions, document start, line lengths).

Sounds like a good idea! What about adding it as a script for all YMLs (and execute in CI)?

issue.title: Support for x86 and ppc64le architectures
issue.body:
As requested in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1019#issuecomment-868131725
Two commits to support builds on x86 (`i686`) and ppc64le, all algorithms are supposed to build as generic implementations.

Tested and all tests are passing on [ALT Linux](http://git.altlinux.org/people/vt/packages/?p=liboqs.git;a=shortlog;h=refs/tags/0.6.0-alt2). Our build logs (with tests run):
* http://git.altlinux.org/tasks/archive/done/_269/275542/build/100/i586/log
* http://git.altlinux.org/tasks/archive/done/_269/275542/build/100/ppc64le/log

ps. These two commits are just `cherry-pick`'ed from our downstream repo, with some conflict resolved for the second one.

comment.body: Thanks @bhess. I've rebased onto main and am just waiting for the build to pass then it can be merged.

issue.title: Remove BIKE R2 and KEM/SIG default algs
first cut removing default algs, biker2, adding biker3

comment.body: Are the NIDs in generate_extras.yml manually synced with the NIDs table in the main OQS-OpenSSL repo?

issue.title: New datasheets
issue.body:
Opening this as a draft PR to get feedback. The main thing to look at is `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` in the latest commit.

- hqc.yml is formatted differently as it was generated by PyYAML (the other non-pqclean datasheets can also be similarly re-generated without much work)
- `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` can be incorporated into `copy_from_upstream.py` once we're set.

comment.body:
> What about adding it as a script for all YMLs (and execute in CI)?

In 3886b87 I added a yamllint run on docs/algorithms as part of test_code_conventions. In the openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 image, yamllint would need to be installed (available with apt).

issue.title: first cut removing default algs, biker2, adding biker3

comment.body:
> Are the NIDs in generate_extras.yml manually synced with the NIDs table in the main OQS-OpenSSL repo?

No. See the discussion in #27. They now simply moved 0x40 up (and away from the "official" code points -- my mistake to call these NIDs).
